pages.text: The sun shines in the zenith, and beneath is a great winged figure with arms extended, pouring down blessings.$(br)  In the foreground are two human figures, male and female, unveiled before each other, as if they first occupied the paradise of the earthly body.$(br)  Behind the male is the Tree of Life bearing burning fruit; and the Tree of Knowledge is behind the female.$(br)  The figures suggest youth, virginity, innocence and love

before it is tainted by material fancy.$(br)  The woman signifies that attraction towards the sensitive life which carries within it the idea of the loss of innocence; but she is rather the working of a secret law of providence than a conscious temptress.$(br)  It is through her slip that the man shall arise ultimately, and only by her can he complete himself. It is an intimation concerning the great mystery of Womanhood.

This is in all simplicity the card of human love, here exhibited as part of the way, the truth and the life.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Love, passionate desire, an important relationship.$(br)  May also mean the merging of opposites.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Difficulties in relationships. Opposition between people.$(br)  The need to rebel against loved ones and society.
